alert.note: Alert for Delaware (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 27 at 3:26AM EDT until June 27 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Chester Creek Near Chester affecting Delaware County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chester Creek Near Chester. * WHEN...From early this morning to this morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, The creek floods adjacent open land. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:02 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 6.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise. It will then fall below flood stage early this morning to 8.5 feet early this morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.6 feet on 09/18/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (3 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Stg Time Date Chester Creek Chester 8.0 6.9 Tue 3 am 2.9 MSG 8.5 4am 6/27 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this morning by 800 AM EDT.
